data.title: Tennessee Williams The Glass Menagerie on Stage
data.meta_description: Come enjoy this award-winning 1944 classic on stage Oct. 17- Oct. 26 with a post-show talk-back Sunday, Oct. 19.
data.text:
Mark the calendar for the award-winning 1944 Tennessee Williams classic The Glass Menagerie on stage Oct. 17- Oct. 26 at Lone Star College-CyFair.

Amanda Wingfield, an aging Southern Belle, longs for her youth and dreams of a better life for her children, Tom and Laura. Her restless son, a would-be poet and the storys narrator, gets swept up in his mothers well-meaning, yet heartbreaking schemes to find his painfully shy sister a husband.

Few plays have explored the byways of the human heart as poignantly and poetically as this exquisite family drama filtered through Toms memory, said Jeff Wax, director.

Performances will be held at 7:30 p.m. Fridays and Saturdays Oct. 17, Oct. 18, Oct. 24, and Oct. 25 and 3 p.m. Sundays Oct. 19 and Oct. 26 in the Main Stage Theatre at 9191 Barker Cypress.

In addition, History Professors James Seymour and Sandra Harvey will moderate a post-show talk-back Sunday, Oct. 19.
